project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a project manager, I need to be able to more easily refer back to the previous/current sprint's workload by assignee while creating a new sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution

Display all currently assigned issues/story points for other open sprints per user on the "Workload by Assignee" screen when starting a new sprint.

h3. Why this is important

This will help me ensure a balanced distribution of work among users in the new sprint I am creating.
 
h3. Workaround 
* In a different browser tab/window, search for open sprints, for example:
{code}
Sprint in openSprints() ORDER BY status ASC
{code}
 * Then go to reports and generate a `Single Level Group By
Assignee` report to see each user's workload
fields.summary: When creating a new sprint, display Workload by Assignee for current sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

cannot remove non-working days from working days tab in board configuration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Board either Scrum or Kanban
 # Step to Configure Board and select *Working days* tab
 # In Non-working days section, add one or more non-working days
 # Observe that it is not possible to then remove it. Clicking on the X button does nothing:

!Screenshot_2020-11-03_at_16_32_02.jpg|thumbnail!

Nothing is recorded into jira logs and also in the browser console.

This happen in both Chrome and Firefox.
h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to remove the added non-working days
h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to remove the added non-working days
h3. Workaround

Use REST API to remove non-working days:

{{POST https://<JIRA_URL>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/workingdays/nonworkingday/remove}}

With body: {noformat}{"rapidViewId": <view id>,"iso8601Date":"YYYY-mm-dd"}{noformat}
fields.summary: cannot remove non-working days from working days tab in board configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Epic burndown chart doesn't include issues that have the epic link populated at issue creation time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic.
 # Create an issue in the epic. Make sure that you populate the epic field when you create the issue.
 # Create a sprint. Put the newly created issue in the sprint and start the sprint.
 # Move the issue to done and complete the sprint.
 # Go to the Epic Burndown chart.

h3. Expected Results
The issue shows up on the Epic Burndown chart and is also present in the 'Completed Issues' section.

h3. Actual Results
The issue doesn't show up in the Epic Burndown.


h3. Workaround
If you change the epic link (move to another link and then back to the epic), the burndown report will be fixed, showing the correct story points.
fields.summary: Epic burndown chart doesn't include issues that have the epic link populated at issue creation time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The checkboxes and radios in Jira Configurable Reports plugin are styled incorrectly after update to AUI 8.4.0 (since Jira 8.4.0).
 AUI checkboxes and radios after 8.4 can't be clicked unless they have a label and Jira's configurable reports don't look like they were designed to require label content for them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install attached plugin [^report.checkbox.issue-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar]
 2. Open any project
 3. Click Reports tab
 4. Find and click "custom.report.label" report
 5. Try click checkbox

To create plugin yourself, follow [tutorial|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/create-a-helloworld-plugin-project/]. Steps for adding the modules  are described [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/framework/atlassian-sdk/modify-the-plugin/]. After running {{atlas-create-jira-plugin-module}} command, type 25 to choose {{Reports}} module type. Then add property to atlassian-plugin.xml: 
{code:java}
<property>
	<key>CheckBox</key>
	<name>CheckBox</name>
	<description/>
	<type>checkbox</type>
</property>
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Checkbox can be toggled.
h3. Actual Results

Checkbox cannot be toggled.
h3. Workaround

Add a description to this 'checkbox' property in atlassian-plugin.xml. It will enable toggling the checkbox by clicking on the description text, but not if clicked on the checkbox itself.
fields.summary: Adding checkbox or radio button in Report plugin is not working (the buttons cannot be clicked)

fields.description:
At the moment when a Sprint is deleted in Jira, *nothing is added to Jira change log history and also there is no notification event available to configure for this.*

What happen is that if a Sprint is deleted, all incomplete issues are automatically moved to the next future sprint (if any).

In this case the change log register a sprint change but still nothing about the deleted sprint which could cause confusion.

For example if a sprint is present on multiple boards where the first board filter all the issues of a given projects and the 2nd one only filters some of the issues of the projects, when deleting the sprint from the 2nd board, user will see only some of the issues moved to the future sprint when there are much more.

So when completing the future sprint in the 2nd board, the user will be confused about which issues are really going to move to the next future sprint.

The sprint deletion is registered into audit logs *but this is only available to Jira Administrators*.
fields.summary: provide a way to notify users about sprint deletion

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We've got a 3 node DC cluster with ~ 45 plugins. A few times a month, we'll have issues with a plugin (random vendors, random issues) and the "fix" from the vendor and/or Atlassian is stop the application, delete the plugin cache, start the application. While we're running a > 1 node DC environment means we can do this without user facing impact (rolling restarts), but the time we drain a node off the LB, stop the application, delete the plugin cache, start the application, reconnect to the LB, let traffic re-balance before we move on to node 2, then 3 - this whole process can take ~ 60-90 minutes. Disabling and re-enabling an add on DOES NOT resolve the issues.

For an enterprise marketed product, this is not good enough. Ideally we'd expect plugins to not work on application start and then partially stop working after a random period of time. While the underlying issue is worked on though, we should at least be able to resolve the issue without an application restart. (eg: disable the plugin, have a web UI option to purge that plugins cache, and then re-enable puts the plugin back on disc).

 

This type of issue costs our support team hours per month in:
 * Debugging issues with plugins
 * Then having to resolve the plugin cache problem by running through a rolling restart/cache clear process
fields.summary: Provide a non-outage/app restart method to refresh plugin cache

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Every now and then we are getting complaints from our users saying that they either cannot attach files to existing issues or that they are unable to create a certain issue after they have filled a certain amount of information in the Create Issue screen. Users complain this is unproductive. In both cases they see a message saying the security token was missing or was invalid.

We advise the users to refresh the page and that usually works for them, however this is not efficient. Please find below the comment of one of our users:

"Yes, the page recovers on a refresh, but I loose all the data I had entered on the page if I have to refresh. I commonly have to take more than an hour to get the data in a page collected(called into a meeting, need to grab screenshots from multiple tools in a lengthy process etc). Prior to expiring my token, the system should cache my data so I can pick it up and continue where i left off, or I should be warned my token is expiring. Or the system should not let me enter data if my token is expired. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira
 # Let the session be inactive until the session expires or redirect the user request to a different node.
 # Start filling a form in Jira, this can be any form which would be submitted to Jira, for example, creating an issue or updating comments.
 # Submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

For the should retain the data in the form fields.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
XSRF Security Token Missing
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: XSRF token error results in missing form data.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using a query like: 

"project = XYZ AND created = 2020-09-30"

no issue will be found.

The reason seems to be that Jira DB saves dates with miliseconds precision, but JQL queries only allow minutes. Thus you cannot even query precisely enough.

This is not intuitive and if users rely on date funcionality they assume no issue is created on that day.

 

Our mitigation at the moment is using queries like:

"project = XYZ AND created >= 2020-09-30 AND created < 2020-10-01"
fields.summary: JQL Queries for dates do not work with '='

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As part of the fix in JSWSERVER-15748 DVCS data is move to the different table AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING. 
For the busy and large instances, this table can grow quite significantly (4GB+), that will eventually slow down the CRUD operations and make it harder to main the Jira instance, due to large size (disk space, backup space). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add options to have clean-up of old DVCS data, possible ideas:
* periodic clean-up job
* consistency check for existing issues 
* deletion of the data as part of project deletion 
* deletion of the data as part of issue archiving (partial data loss)
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to be able to delete old DVCS data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the *Manage Sprints* permission is a project permission. This causes issues whenever boards need to use filters considered "too complex", as Jira needs to perform permission checks against all Jira projects whenever the filter query includes fields that can be included in a wide range of projects such as the *labels* field. 

Therefore, associating this permission with a board instead of on a project-by-project basis could reduce the number of checks performed by Jira, allowing complex filters to be more widely used.
fields.summary: Associate the Manage Sprints permission to boards instead of projects.

fields.description: If the announcement banner is commented out a strip of space is used by the null banner. The banner can be fully deleted but this means there is no handy template for the next announcement. The announcement banner should be wrapped in a div (for html safety) and would typically include some tweakable size and colour styles as appropriate for the importance of the message. Rather that reinvent the wheel each banner it is useful to have some template in place for the banner, eg, {code:xml} {code} Ideally I keep this banner then update the message and maybe style then remove the commenting and save. {quote}
Amount of time anticipated to resolve the issue after completing this unit of work. You can adjust this value using the following options:
* Adjust Automatically - Adjust the remaining estimate value by subtracting the amount of work logged in the Time Spent field from the remaining estimate current value.
* Leave Estimate unset - This option is displayed only if no time estimate has been specified on the issue. You can use this option when you want to keep track of work, but you don't necessarily have a time estimate for an issue.
* Use Existing Estimate of - Select this option if you do not want to change the issue remaining estimate value.
* Set to - You can adjust the remaining estimate value to the amount of time you specify in this field.
* Reduce by - Select this option to manually adjust the remaining estimate value by subtracting the amount of time you specify in this field.
{quote}

Please provide a way to set those option as default for all the issues in a project.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
DCVS uses a regex pattern to determine issue keys that have commit data. When projects are deleted and a new project is created with the same key, this can lead to DVCS shenanigans. Historical commits and PR data will be synced to the new Jira keys. So in essence reusing project keys is causing historical commits and PRs to display in a project where they shouldn't. The sync is an all or nothing thing right now. 
h3. How To Replicate
 # create a Jira instance
 # create a project
 # create a dvcs link to GH or GHE
 # delete the project
 # recreate a project with the same key but different usage
 # DVCS will start syncing the old project's commit data as the new issue keys match the regex

h3. Workaround:

If you're a JIRA Data Center user you can archive the project which will lock the project key from being reused.
fields.summary: Add the ability to "blacklist" repos from syncing with certain projects in the DVCS connector for Github accounts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * The issue happens when the user opens any board with more than one issue, and the board filter is ordering by the lexorank {{project = KSP ORDER BY Rank ASC}} then try to move the issue to any other column. There are two observed errors, and they are intermittent.

 # The iOS app closes.
 # The user receives the following error:
{code:java}
"Error marking step #4551694 finished: root cause: Tried to update an entity that does not exist."{code}

h4. Tests performed:
 * (/) The procedure works successfully on iOS 13.
 * (!) The issue is reproducible on any device running iOS 14 and the latest

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Application and plugin version:
 ## Jira 8.5.7
 ## Jira Mobile App: 3;2;8
 ## Mobile Plugin for Jira: 1.0.5
 # Install the Jira Server App on iOS 14
 # Create one project with a few issues
 # Create one board for this project and access via the mobile APP
 # Move any issue between the columns.

fields.description: Scanners may falsely flag some versions of Jira Software Server before 8.5.5 as vulnerable to an Insecure Deserialization issue in Jackson Databind (CVE-2018-14720). This vulnerability in a transitive dependency was being flagged because Jira Software assumed the version of applinks provided by Jira Core was an earlier version of applinks but Jira Core was actually providing a newer version that was not vulnerable to CVE-2018-14720. Jira Software Server has been updated to assume that Jira Core is providing the newer version of applinks so that scanners should not flag this issue in versions after 8.5.5.
fields.summary: JSW Server not vulnerable to an Insecure Deserialization issue in Jackson Databind - CVE-2018-14720

fields.description:
Generating the initial lexorank can seriously affect issue creation time.

This problem can be observed in 2 ways:
 # contention on lexorank lock when initialising rank when creating issue
 # some nodes are never able to get the lexorank lock and create the lexorank initial value

h3. Problem 1

This problem will manifests itself by increased issue creation time. 

In logs we need to enable *DEBUG* logging on *com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank*.

The failed locks should show up in the *atlassian-greenhopper.log* log.
{code:java}
DEBUG Failed to acquire a lock on the max marker row and previous row for rank field{code}
The indexing stats (*indexing-stats*) should also show the *Rank* custom field as expensive - note the max value as the lower value of the average may be "improved" by the updates which will not trigger the expensive Lexorank initialization.
{code:java}
cat ./atlassian-jira.log | grep indexing-stats | grep total

INFO      [c.a.j.issue.index.IndexingStatsManager] [indexing-stats] Top 10 addIndex total... {order:1, name:customfield_15080 (Rank), isKnown:false, addIndex: {sum:1728649386ms, avg:1765.5ms, max:7199ms, count:979152} ...{code}
* Note:  avg: *1765.5ms*,  max: 7199ms

h3. Problem 2 

This problem will manifests itself by increased issue creation time in the range of 18-20sec.

Lexorank is unable to get the lexorank lock (and create the lexorank initial value) and the issue is indexed with Lexorank.MAX. 

This will be seen in the *atlassian-greenhopper.log* log as warnings:
{code:java}
WARN [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] Unable to retrieve rank for field [10005] and issue [2010933]
WARN [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] gh.lexorank.service.error.retrytimeout
WARN [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=2010933]. Indexing max LexoRank value instead.
{code}

h3. Notes
* Individual ranking operation has _1500 ms_ timeout for rank lock. Due to DB contetion and slow operation, issue ranking operation fails to save new rank since rank lock expire.
* See KB for more details regarding Lexorank: [Troubleshooting New Ranking System Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-new-ranking-system-issues-779159221.html] 

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Lexorank affects issue creation time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Organization once removed from the Project still present in Jira. There is no way to list the Organization which are not part of any of the Project. Jira should list the Oragnizations which are not part of the any of the Project. This can further help in deleting those unused Organization.
h3. Workaround

As of now, the only way to delete the Organization which is not part of any Project is given below -
 - Go to the *Customers* page of any Service Desk project
 - If the organization that you wish to delete does not show there, it could be that it exists in the database but that it was removed from that particular project. In this case, what you need to do is click on *Add organizations* and copy/paste the name of the organization from the database. The organization should now show in the *Customers* page
 - Click on the organization that you wish to delete
 - Click on *... > Delete organization*. The organization and all its dependencies will be completely deleted from the database

Do have caveat, one should know the list of the Organization which are not part of any Group first, so as to get deleted.
fields.summary: Way to Find / delete List of Organization which are not part of any Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When filling a Custom Field on a Tab, the Tab is not represented when viewing the issue.
 The Tab is only represented if you do fill other Fields on another Tab (except System Fields as Summary, Description, Labels, Priority, Issue link).
 * Per the Documentation: [Defining a screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-a-screen-938847288.html] - There is no mention that it is required to have more content filled on other tabs to show the tabs:
{quote}If none of the fields on a tab contain data then the tab is not shown. To make a tab show up, make sure *it has a custom field with a type such as Text or Select and that the field has a value.*
{quote}

So, or the documentation is incomplete, or the behavior of the Tags is not working as expected.

 

The Knowledge Base [Tabs Don't Show up on View Issue Screen in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/tabs-don-t-show-up-on-view-issue-screen-in-jira-873947916.html] has a "Design Justification" on it:
{quote}The logic behind the functionality comes down to the distinction between what should be visible when viewing (only relevant information) and editing (all editable fields) an issue. We’re hiding empty custom fields and tabs on the “View issue” screen to improve readability and performance (by rendering a lower number of fields). Displaying all custom fields would make the issue unclear especially when a large number of custom fields are defined.
{quote}
However, *per Customer perception*:
 This is a poor design choice (if I put the fields on a tab, I expect it to show on a tab).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a New Project Area TESTTAB
 * Create a Custom Field "mytextA" using the format "Text Field (single line)", another Custom Field "mytextB" also "'Text Field (single line)' Field" and a Custom Field Date "mydate", as date picker.
 * Edit the "TESTTAB: Scrum Default Issue Screen" screen, adding:
 ** rename the "Field Tab" with all the default fields to "Tab1"
 ** Add a new tab "Tab2" with the Custom Field "mydate"
 ** Add a new tab "Tab3" with the Custom Field "mytextA"
 ** Add a new tab "Tab4" with the Custom Field "mytextB"
 * Create a new Story:
 ** Fills the field Summary, on "Tab1"
 ** Switch to tab "Tab3" and fills the field "mytextA"
 * View the issue created

h3. Expected Results

See "Tab3" with the "mytextA" content
h3. Actual Results
 * "Tab3" is not showed
 * "mytextA" is showed on Tab1.

h3. Workaround
 * Filling any content at the "mytextB" on "Tab4" will show both "Tab3" and "Tab4"
 * Filling "mydate" at the "Tab2" does not show "Tab2" and "Tab3". The date is listed on "Tab1" at the Date Section.
 * Filling "Epic Link" at the "Tab1" will show "Tab3"
 * Filling "Description", "Priority" or "Labels" will not show Tab3
fields.summary: When filling a Custom Field on a Tab, the Tab is not represented when viewing the issue

Since a couple of years we are using Jira Portfolio, in which stories, features and business epics are practically stored in separate Jira projects and coupled with each other, often making use of the parent link.


Our users would like the parent link clearly shown in the card layout display (backlog view), preferably on the first line.

The fields in the first line of the card layout are now fixed and not customizable. Some of these fields (Epic link, fix version) are not necessarily most important for these users. Yes, the display can be configured to add 3 more fields, but these fields appear on the second line of the display, making the total view less simple, and prone to losing overview.

fields.description:
Given reduced retention periods for Organisational and product audit logs to days as opposed to months/years, it's often an organisations requirement to extract logs into a SIEM or log aggregation tool to fulfill retention requirements.

The method to extract with Atlassian Cloud differs from Organisation and Product Tools.

Organisation audit logs can be extracted with API tokens that have granted full admin privileges with conflicts with least privilege policies. However at least these are centrally maintained.

For Jira Cloud and Confluence cloud, the API tokens used to extract these Audit logs is based on an explicit users permission, so other admins can see/manage them. 

If these were managed centrally so any admin can manage them, rather than linked to a user that may leave would be an improvement.

A work around of creating a specific user to generate this API token becomes complex with SSO and MFA enabled. This also consumes a valuable product licence.

 

Improvement in the consistent / centralisation of audit logs to Organisation would be ultimate suggestion, at the least to allow ability to create audit log API token not tied to a user would be next best solution
fields.summary: API Audit Logs extraction Improvements to centralised Token Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Microsoft has enabled a new MAPI property type called PT_MV_I8 in Microsoft 365 Exchange Online.
 That caused Jira to identify some Inbox messages as corrupted and thus not processing it.
 Issue happens using Jira Mail Handler(using POP or IMAP).

Microsoft has identified to be a client-side issue also affecting their Outlook client.
 They have created the document [Outlook crashes in OLMAPI32!CopyProps function when using applications that process emails|https://support.microsoft.com/en-ie/office/outlook-crashes-in-olmapi32-copyprops-function-when-using-applications-that-process-emails-4e773692-7010-4743-9e13-0c9443b71126] about the problem.
 The document [Microsoft page about Outlook MAPI Property types|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office/client-developer/outlook/mapi/property-types] has more detailed information about MAPI parameters.

Microsoft has disabled the parameter as a temporary workaround, but as soon as the Outlook team fixes it, the parameter will be enabled again.
 Moving messages out and back to Inbox makes them to be successfully reprocessed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

It is not possible to reproduce it as the Outlook MAPI property was disabled by Microsoft on Exchange Online service.
h3. Expected Results

Jira Mail must be able to read and process Inbox messages containing the recently enabled parameter PT_MV_I8.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the +*atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log*+ file:
{noformat}
2020-07-07 16:15:05,829 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12[12010]: Found 1 unprocessed message(s) in the pop3s folder
2020-07-07 16:15:05,829 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 Processing message
2020-07-07 16:15:05,829 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 TOP 1 0
2020-07-07 16:15:06,105 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 -ERR Message corrupted     <<------- Corruption error.
2020-07-07 16:15:06,106 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 RETR 1
2020-07-07 16:15:06,170 DEBUG [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 -ERR Message corrupted
2020-07-07 16:15:06,170 ERROR [example@company.com] Caesium-1-4 anonymous    jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12 jsd_onpl_v3_2019-06-12[12010]: Exception: can't retrieve message #1 in POP3Message.getContentStream
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Processing e-mails with Jira Mail handler from MS Exchange Online mailboxes fails with "-ERR Message corrupted"

The documentation for the Jira Software Server REST API is currently available under this URL:

* {{https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/}}

At that URL, there is a long list of releases, and the "latest" link is usually a redirect to the documentation for the latest release (right now, it's one release behind :) ).  This is a convenient alias for linking to the latest documentation, or for saving a bookmark.

However, for companies using the Long-Term Support releases (formerly known as the "Enterprise" release stream), there is no easy way to link to the documentation of the current LTS release.  We have to hard-code the specific version number in each of our links or bookmarks.

Please add a redirect for "lts" (or some similar identifier) to the REST API documentation for the current LTS release, to enable simpler and up-to-date references to documentation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Remaining estimate update is not reflected in history when updated via transition screen and when there's a post function present to update 'Original estimate in the workflow'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a transition screen with 'Log work' and 'Time tracking' and assign that transition screen to a transition in a workflow
 # Add a post function to that same transition (for the purpose of this case we will use 'Done' transition) to update 'Remaining estimate' or 'Original Estimate' field to 0
 # Publish the workflow
 # Add 'time tracking' field to the issue screen
 # Create or modify an issue 'remaining estimate' value to any value and notice the change get's reflected properly in the history
 # Perform the 'Done' transition and enter 'Remaining estimate' value as 0

We use out of the box post function to set the remaining estimate value to 0 when the issue is moved to completed.
h3. Expected Results

The 'remaining estimate' change should be reflected in the history of the issue
h3. Actual Results

The 'remaining estimate' value on the case does get updated to '0' but the change is not reflected in the case history

Another impact due to this bug, is that the burndown chart for remaining estimate is not working as expected
h3. Workaround

Don't use both the transition screen and a post function on the same transition to update time tracking fields
fields.summary: Remaining estimate update is not reflected in history when updated via transition screen and when there's a post function present to update 'Remaining estimate' field in the workflow'

h3. Issue Summary
Boards in project icon doesn't appear in collapsed side bar when users doesn't have Create Shared Objects global permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with multiple boards. 
# Browse one of these boards as a user without the *Create Shared Objects* global permission.

h3. Expected Results
User sees the *boards in this project* icon and can hover it to show the list.
 !icon_visible.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Icon isn't visible:
 !icon_not_visible.png|thumbnail! 
* When the side bar is expanded and the board menu is clicked, boards in project will show. 
* When the side bar is collapsed again, the icon will keep showing. 
* When page is refreshed, the issue will occur again. 
* When the side bar is expanded and the board menu is expanded, a request goes to */rest/projects/1.0/project/<PROJECT_KEY>/rapidviews*. This populates the list of boards in project so the icon becomes visible the next time the side bar is collapsed. 
* The issue doesn't occur in 7.13. 

h3. Workaround
Add the global permission to the users or educate them on expanding the list before.
fields.summary: Boards in project icon doesn't appear in collapsed side bar when users doesn't have Create Shared Objects global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a release that is linked to an issue is deleted in Bamboo when Jira is down or when there are some connection issues between Jira and Bamboo, the application will not receive the "release deleted" message and will not update AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY table. 

So the development panel will still show the link to a deployment when it doesn't exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a build to an issue
# Deploy the build
# Shut down Jira
# Delete the release in Bamboo
# Startup Jira and check the development panel of the Linked issue

h3. Expected Results
The development panel will not show the deleted deployment.

h3. Actual Results
The development panel still shows the "Deployed to" in the development panel, and if we click on it shows the following message:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-21 at 17.53.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the query below to delete the development information in the issue:
{code:sql}
DELETE
FROM "AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY"
WHERE "AO_575BF5_DEV_SUMMARY"."JSON" LIKE '%ISSUE-KEY%';
{code}
When accessing the issue again, Jira will recreate the entry in the database and will show the correct information.
fields.summary: Development panel breaks if a release is deleted when Jira is down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are warnings being triggered on the latest Jira software version due to the `RequestCacheImpl` being used outside of a request thread by the `JMXInstrumentsLoggingService`. This will not work in the future, so we need to fix it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software v8.11

The below exception is thrown in the Atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-17 13:50:05,242+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService STARTING INFO      [atlassian-performance] Scheduling JMXINSTRUMENTS with poll interval of 60 seconds 2020-07-17 13:50:05,243+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService STARTING 

INFO      [atlassian-performance] all services started and healthy 2020-07-17 13:50:05,243+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details. 2020-07-17 13:50:05,243+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException. 2020-07-17 

13:50:05,244+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details. 2020-07-17 13:50:05,244+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException. 2020-07-17 13:51:05,247+0530 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
h4. Tried workaround JSDSERVER-6897
h4. set the package to ERROR (this setting will remain after a Jira restart)
 - Edit the file {{<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}
 - Add the 2 following lines at the end of the file and save it:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = ERROR, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = false
{code}

 - Restart the Jira application
fields.summary: JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN   - RequestCache being used in an invalid context

h3. Issue Summary

When using Original Time Estimate on a board for Estimation, the Velocity Chart will show time in seconds rather than hours or minutes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a few issues in a board and modify the Estimate field on the issue to be in hours or minutes.
# Start a sprint and add these issues to them.
# Complete the sprint and open up the Velocity Chart once complete.

h3. Expected Results

The Velocity chart will show the committed and completed time for issues to be within hours or minutes.

h3. Actual Results

The time for these values shows up in seconds instead:

!Screen Shot 2020-07-16 at 12.57.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use a different Estimation statistic such as Story Points for the board.

h3. Notes

I found that this issue could not be reproduced in Jira 8.3.0. It's possible this is due to the change in the Velocity Chart changes that were made in 8.9.0
fields.summary: When using Original Time Estimate on a board for Estimation, the Velocity Chart will show time in seconds rather than hours or minutes
